definition: expression of gratitude/to give thanks/a thank-you note/acknowledgement
to send/to devote/to deliver/to cause/to convey
to thank/to apologize/to wither (of flowers, leaves etc)/to decline

sentences.english: Received your E mail this morning thanking Mr. Hitching Wang for something he's done for you.
sentences.chinese: 今晨接到一封你寄給王志成先生的致謝函。

sentences.english: NO04,5. I don't know how to thank you for all your help.
sentences.chinese: 你鼎力相助，我真不知該如何致謝纔好。

sentences.english: I never received a thank-you note for either.
sentences.chinese: 不過關於這兩份禮物，我從來沒有收到任何致謝函。

sentences.english: The credit shall also include a hypertext link to the Developer's Web Site.
sentences.chinese: 致謝內容應包括開發方網站的超鏈接。

sentences.english: The beggar bowed his thanks when people gave him money.
sentences.chinese: 當人們給他錢時，那乞丐便欠身致謝。

sentences.english: Nancy smiled and thanked the butler.
sentences.chinese: 南希微笑着向男管家致謝。

sentences.english: The crowds bursted into cheers and the drunk bowed to them.
sentences.chinese: 觀衆歡呼起來，醉漢向人們鞠躬致謝。

sentences.english: Doran stuck his head out of the window to acknowledge the cheering .
sentences.chinese: 多蘭將頭探出窗戶向歡呼的人們致謝。

sentences.english: Andy catches Red's eye, nods his thanks.
sentences.chinese: 安迪用眼睛會意瑞德，並點頭致謝。

sentences.english: One young conscript rose with a message of thanks, his voice choked with emotion.
sentences.chinese: 一個年輕的新兵起立致謝，激動得聲音哽咽。

sentences.english: Lesser contributions should usually be noted in the acknowledgments section of the manuscript.
sentences.chinese: 相對次要的貢獻者可在“致謝”部分列出。

sentences.english: At the edge of the wedged hedge, I acknowledged the knowledgeable man.
sentences.chinese: 在楔形籬笆的邊緣上，我向那位博識的人致謝。

sentences.english: In particular, I wanna give a shout-out to all the moms in the house.
sentences.chinese: 尤其是，我想要向在場的所有媽媽們致謝。

sentences.english: Don't forget to make acknowledgments after an interview.
sentences.chinese: 面試結束後，要記得致謝。

sentences.english: Inside the envelope was a little green and white thank you card.
sentences.chinese: 信封內是一張小小的綠白相間的致謝卡。

definition: different mouths, same voice/to speak in unison (idiom)
Zheng state during the Warring States period/surname Zheng/abbr. for 鄭州|郑州[Zheng4 zhou1]
the younger generation/those who come after
